page.title: 13THE FISH FACTORY
page.content: The factory was built in 1977 at a cost of Â£0.25M.Before the factory was built by the harbour the old Brough School was used. Altogether 113 people work there:26 filleters,25 packers,60 labourers,2 drivers.Of the workers 70 are full- time. The kinds of fish handled are {cod}, {haddock}and{whiting}.Fish is first washed,then finned,filleted,skinned, washed again,then frozen.{Cod}is frozen in 7kg blocks which are sold to U.K.customers for making into fish fingers.{Haddock}and{Whiting}are frozen as fillets which are sold to customers in U.S.A. and Australia. In a day about 250 40kg boxes are processed.Filleters earn about Â£150per wk.,packers Â£95,labourers Â£120.The weekly wage bill is Â£12000.The present annual turnover Â£2.1M, running costs Â£2M.
